availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Lowey (Caldwell County, Kentucky, wagonmaker & county jailor)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, wagonmaker and county jailer. Tennessee native. Married to Mary A. Carner Lowey in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 18, 1844. Father of Cordelia Addie Lowey and George M. Lowey. Wagonmaker in Caldwell County in 1850. County jailer in Caldwell County in 1860. County jailer in Caldwell County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 280A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 115.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 509A.
Find A Grave, "James S. Lowey (1817-1876)," Memorial #196588127, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/196588127 (accessed February 17, 2021).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000851644.
KYR-0001-021-0033.
